lesmer.intro: Where can I find information about my case?
lesmer.avsnitt: You can log in to Your parental allowance and see the status of your application. You can also submit application attachments.

lesmer.intro: When will I get a response to my application?
lesmer.avsnitt: The earliest you will receive a response to your application is 4 weeks the start of your parental benefit period. This is because we use the most recent information about your income when we calculate how much parental benefit you will receive.

Perantal benefit is paid out by the 25th of the month. You see how much perantal benefit you get paid on your NAV, under the payout schedule. If you receive parental benefit from your employer, you must contact the employer for the pay date and payout schedule.

lesmer.intro: Can I receive parental benefit while I am a student?
lesmer.avsnitt: To be entitled to parental benefit, you must have had income in six of the past 10 months. Student loans and grants from the Norwegian State Educational Loan Fund ("Lånekassen") do not provide entitlement to parental benefit. If you are not entitled to parental benefit, you can apply for a lump-sum grant. Try our "veiviser" to see what you may be entitled to.

lesmer.intro: I receive benefits from NAV. Am I entitled to receive parental benefit?

liste.punkt: Care benefit, attendance allowance or training allowance

lesmer.avsnitt: Are you unsure of what you may be entitled to?Use the wizard to find out what you are entitled to.

lesmer.intro: What is the difference between parental benefit and lump-sum grant?
lesmer.avsnitt: Parental benefit provides you with income while you are at home with your child. Lump-sum grant is benefit paid out as a single lump sum to people who are expecting a child and have not had income in the past year. You can choose to receive a lump-sum grant even if you are entitled to parental benefit, but you can only receive one of these benefits.
Are you unsure of what you may be entitled to?Use the wizard to find out what you are entitled to.

lesmer.intro: What is the difference between the parental benefit period and the shared period?
lesmer.avsnitt: The parental benefit period is the entire period during which parental benefit is paid. When both parents are entitled to parental benefit, the parental benefit period consists of 3 weeks of parental benefit for the mother before delivery, a maternal quota, a paternal quota and a shared period.
You can use our parental benefit planner to plan how long you can stay at home with your child.

lesmer.intro: I am going to take unpaid leave
lesmer.avsnitt: You must arrange unpaid leave with your employer. You cannot postpone when you receive parental benefit if you are on unpaid leave. The other parent may postpone their parental benefit on grounds of full-time work, illness or holiday in the period you are on unpaid leave. You can use our parental benefit planner to plan how long you can stay at home with your child.
Unpaid leave may affect your entitlement to other NAV benefits and accumulation of rights to parental benefit for new children. Read more about your rights here.
